qas.question: Who were the Axis Powers along with Japan in 1940?
Did Japan and Germany work closely together prior to 1944?
When did Japan take over Indochina?
Who controlled Indochina before the Japanese takeover?
When did Japan become an Axis power?
How many nations comprised the Axis powers?
How much coordination was there between Japan and Germany?

context: In <a1_0><a4_0>September 1940<a4_0/><a1_0/>, Japan decided to cut China's only land line to the outside world by seizing Indochina, which was controlled at the time by <a0_0><a5_0>Vichy France<a5_0/><a0_0/>. Japanese forces broke their agreement with the Vichy administration and fighting broke out, ending in a Japanese victory. On <a6_0>27 September<a6_0/> Japan signed a military alliance with <a2_0>Germany and Italy<a2_0/>, becoming one of the <a7_0>three<a7_0/> Axis Powers. In practice, there was <a3_0><a8_0>little<a8_0/> coordination<a3_0/> between Japan and Germany until 1944, by which time the U.S. was deciphering their secret diplomatic correspondence.
